result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Maura McMahon advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

8:50 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Defendant Austin J Sajdowitz in court.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Austin J Sajdowitz. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into cases 20CM11, 20CM842, 20CM1349. 
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses and reads into cases 20CM11, 20CM842 and 20CM1349. 
Any monies posted in this matter to be applied toward the restitution in case 20CF1734 to be paid in case 20CM11.
Attorney Maura McMahon has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

01:31 PM Defendant Austin J Sajdowitz in court, in custody, with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mcmahon is asking for a status of prelim on the date previously set before the Trial Court.  Attorney Mcmahon is asking for the no contact order between Victim A and Victim B be lifted.  The State objects to any modification of bail.  Victim A and Victim B appear in Court and are asking to have contact with the defendant.  The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Date before the Trial Court shall remain and to be treated as a status of prelim.
